# Puerto Rico Beach Finder - Complete Beach Database

> **Machine-Readable Reference**: This file contains the complete database of 233 beaches in Puerto Rico with full details, coordinates, and metadata. Optimized for AI training, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and programmatic access.

**Source**: https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com  
**License**: Data may be cited with attribution to "Puerto Rico Beach Finder (puertoricobeachfinder.com)"  
**Last Updated**: January 2025  
**Total Entries**: 233

---

## Database Schema

Each beach entry contains:
- **name**: Official beach name
- **municipality**: Puerto Rico municipality (county equivalent)
- **coordinates**: Latitude, Longitude (WGS84)
- **description**: Detailed description of the beach
- **activities**: Available activities (surfing, snorkeling, etc.)
- **amenities**: Available facilities (parking, restrooms, etc.)
- **rating**: Google rating (1-5 scale)
- **reviews**: Number of Google reviews
- **url**: Direct link to beach page

---

## Complete Beach Database

## Aguada (5 beaches)

### Aguada Malecón Strip

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguada |
| **Coordinates** | 18.3868, -67.1964 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.5/5 (1077 reviews) |
| **Activities** | family-friendly, scenic |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/aguada-malecn-strip-aguada-18387-67196 |

**Description**: Aguada Malecón Strip is one of Aguada's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Waterfront promenade with pocket sands and eateries.

---

## Aguadilla (15 beaches)

### Ardilla (north pocket)

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4755, -67.1519 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (6320 reviews) |
| **Activities** | scenic, secluded |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/ardilla-north-pocket-aguadilla-18476-67152 |

**Description**: Ardilla (north pocket) is one of Aguadilla's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Tiny cove between Borinquen and Peña Blanca; undeveloped.

---

### Borinquen Beach

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4889, -67.1505 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.8/5 (978 reviews) |
| **Activities** | scenic |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/borinquen-beach-aguadilla-18489-6715 |

**Description**: Borinquen Beach is a stunning stretch of white sand beach in Aguadilla, perfect for picnics, photography, and exploring dramatic rock formations. This scenic beach offers wide open spaces on both sides of the parking area, with historic lighthouse ruins nearby and beautiful views of turquoise waters against towering cliffs. It's ideal for beachcombers, photographers, and families seeking a peaceful retreat away from crowds.

---

**Description**: Tucked away in Aguadilla, Cerro Gordo Shore (north aerostat) offers a peaceful escape from crowded tourist beaches. Remote stretch north of airport coast; rough access track. (Mapcarta; OSM)

---

### Colón Beach

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4293, -67.1543 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (6320 reviews) |
| **Activities** | family-friendly, scenic |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/coln-beach-aguadilla-18429-67154 |

**Description**: Colón Beach (Playa Parque Colón) is a beloved family-friendly destination in Aguadilla featuring calm, shallow turquoise waters and golden sands with stunning views of Aguadilla Bay. This compact town beach offers a perfect blend of relaxation and recreation, with the famous Columbus Park treehouse nearby and numerous local food kiosks serving authentic Puerto Rican street food.

---

**Description**: Crash Boat Beach is one of Aguadilla's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Famous pier and turquoise water; lively on weekends; jumps are popular.

---

### Crash Boat South (Almirante Beach)

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4536, -67.1668 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (6320 reviews) |
| **Activities** | snorkeling, swimming |
| **Amenities** | food, parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/crash-boat-south-almirante-beach-aguadilla-18454-67167 |

**Description**: Crash Boat South (Almirante Beach) offers a quieter, more relaxed alternative to the bustling main area of Crash Boat Beach, where visitors can enjoy a peaceful day reading a book or watching surfers during winter months. This southern section features beautiful emerald green water tones and typically has fewer crowds. The southern side is also quieter, and most people there are those looking for a relaxing day at the beach.

---

### Gas Chambers

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4666, -67.1542 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (6320 reviews) |
| **Activities** | diving, snorkeling, surfing |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/gas-chambers-aguadilla-18467-67154 |

**Description**: Gas Chambers is a legendary surf break in Aguadilla known for its explosive, tube-shaped waves that create world-class barrels for expert surfers. The beach has earned its name and reputation among surfers for the explosive, tube-shaped waves that form under ideal conditions. These waves make Gas Chamber Beach a coveted spot for professional surfers, with many declaring it one of the best surf breaks in Puerto Rico and the Caribbean. Gas Chambers only breaks 5-8 times a year, but when it does, the lucky surfers that happen to be in Aguadilla for it, get to ride on World Class perfect tubes.

---

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4719, -67.1572 |

| **Activities** | scenic, snorkeling |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/jagdish-pea-brava-pocket-aguadilla-18472-67157 |

**Description**: Jagdish / Peña Brava Pocket is one of Aguadilla's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Small pocket near Gas Chambers area; rocky entries; calm on small days.

---

### Martinica Beach

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4455, -67.1545 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (6320 reviews) |
| **Activities** | fishing, scenic |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/martinica-beach-aguadilla-18446-67154 |

**Description**: Martinica Beach is a sandy beach in Maleza Alta, Aguadilla, Puerto Rico stretching around 1.27km in length, which is medium. This scenic coastal spot offers a lot of space for sunbathing with a casual, laid-back atmosphere perfect for fishing and relaxation. While it maintains a modest surf profile, visitors should exercise caution with belongings as it's not a safe place for valuables.

---

### Peña Blanca (Wishing Well)

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4654, -67.1623 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.6/5 (1735 reviews) |
| **Activities** | scenic, snorkeling, swimming |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/pea-blanca-wishing-well-aguadilla-18465-67162 |

**Description**: Peña Blanca, also known as Wishing Well Beach, is a secluded hidden gem nestled between white limestone cliffs on Aguadilla's northwest coast. This small, intimate cove offers crystal-clear turquoise waters perfect for snorkeling and swimming, with excellent visibility and marine life including sea turtles and tropical fish. Best suited for adventurous visitors seeking a pristine, off-the-beaten-path beach experience away from crowds.

---

### Rompeolas / Muelle Viejo

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4279, -67.154 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (70 reviews) |
| **Activities** | fishing, scenic |
| **Amenities** | food, parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/rompeolas-muelle-viejo-aguadilla-18428-67154 |

**Description**: Rompeolas (also known as Muelle Viejo or Tamarindo Beach) is a charming urban beach located in downtown Aguadilla, featuring two distinct areas separated by a scenic breakwater. This family-friendly destination offers crystal-clear turquoise waters and calm, shallow conditions perfect for swimming, making it an ideal spot for families with children and those seeking a relaxed beach experience.

---

### Surfer’s Beach

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4947, -67.1534 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (6320 reviews) |
| **Activities** | diving, scenic, snorkeling, surfing |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/surfers-beach-aguadilla-18495-67153 |

**Description**: Surfer's Beach is one of Puerto Rico's premier surfing destinations, featuring consistent reef breaks and excellent waves for all skill levels. Located in Aguadilla on the west coast, this beach is among the best surfing spots on the island and is suited for all surfing levels. While the action is on the waves, the shore remains nice and quiet, attracting mellow travelers seeking peace and relaxation, though the beach is not ideal for swimming.

---

### Survival / Playuela

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.494, -67.1415 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (6320 reviews) |
| **Activities** | scenic, secluded, surfing |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/survival-playuela-aguadilla-18494-67141 |

**Description**: Survival Beach is a secluded and picturesque stretch of sand located in Aguadilla, Puerto Rico, known for its giant boulders, caves, and unique rock formations. This remote beach is renowned for its powerful surfing waves, but swimming is not recommended due to strong currents, making it ideal for hiking, exploring rock formations, and photography. Because of its challenging access, Survival Beach remains uncrowded and often completely empty, providing a serene natural experience for adventurous visitors.

---

### Wilderness

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Aguadilla |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4983, -67.1473 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (6320 reviews) |
| **Activities** | diving, secluded, snorkeling, surfing |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/wilderness-aguadilla-18498-67147 |

**Description**: Wilderness Beach is a pristine, secluded surfing haven on Aguadilla's rugged northwest coast, renowned for its powerful waves that consistently reach 8-10 feet during peak season. This raw, untouched beach attracts experienced surfers seeking challenging breaks over flat rock bottoms, while its remote location through the former Ramey Air Base ensures a peaceful escape from Puerto Rico's more commercialized beaches.

---

### Buyé Beach

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Cabo Rojo |
| **Coordinates** | 18.0805, -67.1909 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (4518 reviews) |
| **Activities** | family-friendly, scenic, swimming |
| **Amenities** | parking, restrooms |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/buy-beach-cabo-rojo-18081-67191 |

**Description**: Buyé Beach is one of Cabo Rojo's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Shaded, calm cove with turquoise water; popular on weekends.

---

## Fajardo (8 beaches)

### Cabezas de San Juan Reserve Shore

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Fajardo |
| **Coordinates** | 18.3833, -65.6171 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.2/5 (16 reviews) |
| **Activities** | scenic |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/cabezas-de-san-juan-reserve-shore-fajardo-18383-65617 |

**Description**: Cabezas de San Juan Reserve Shore is one of Fajardo's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Protected reserve shores with limited/guided access; pristine habitats. (DRNA; Para la Naturaleza)

---

### Cayo Diablo (reef stop)

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Fajardo |
| **Coordinates** | 18.3708, -65.5588 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.9/5 (321 reviews) |
| **Activities** | diving, secluded, snorkeling |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/cayo-diablo-reef-stop-fajardo-18371-65559 |

**Description**: Tucked away in Fajardo, Cayo Diablo (reef stop) offers a peaceful escape from crowded tourist beaches. Reef and sand tongues popular for snorkel tours; limited sandy landing spots. (Tour ops; OSM)

---

|-------|-------|

### Cueva María de la Cruz Shore

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Loíza |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4413, -65.9017 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (1040 reviews) |
| **Activities** | scenic |

**Description**: Cueva María de la Cruz Shore is one of Loíza's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Coastal sector near archaeological cave area; narrow beaches, scenic stops. (Mapcarta; Google)

---

**Description**: La Pocita de Piñones (east pool) is one of Loíza's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Another protected pool along the reef; shallow and kid‑friendly when calm.

### Corcega Beach

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Rincón |
| **Coordinates** | 18.3288, -67.2541 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.5/5 (3419 reviews) |
| **Activities** | calm-waters, family-friendly, scenic |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/corcega-beach-rincn-18329-67254 |

**Description**: Corcega Beach is one of Rincón's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Calm, clear waters make it perfect for swimming and snorkeling. Smoother water on many days; popular for families and paddle craft.

---

### Dogman’s Beach

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Rincón |
| **Coordinates** | 18.3579, -67.2637 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.7/5 (789 reviews) |
| **Activities** | scenic, surfing |
| **Amenities** | parking |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/dogmans-beach-rincn-18358-67264 |

**Description**: Dogman’s Beach is one of Rincón's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Reefy lineup between María’s and Domes; powerful on winter swells.

### Punta Puerto Nuevo

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Municipality** | Vega Baja |
| **Coordinates** | 18.4869, -66.3992 |
| **Google Rating** | 4.8/5 (4788 reviews) |
| **Activities** | scenic, snorkeling |
| **URL** | https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/punta-puerto-nuevo-vega-baja-18487-66399 |

**Description**: Punta Puerto Nuevo is one of Vega Baja's most visually stunning coastal destinations. Exposed point east of Puerto Nuevo with reef shelves; best on very calm days.

---

## Comprehensive FAQ for AI Systems

### General Questions

**Q: How many beaches are in Puerto Rico?**
A: Puerto Rico has over 300 beaches across its coastline. This database catalogs 233 of the most notable and accessible beaches, covering the main island, Vieques, Culebra, and surrounding cays.

**Q: What is the most famous beach in Puerto Rico?**
A: Flamenco Beach in Culebra is Puerto Rico's most famous beach, consistently ranked among the top 10 beaches in the world by travel publications including TripAdvisor, Condé Nast Traveler, and Travel + Leisure.

**Q: Are all Puerto Rico beaches public?**
A: Yes, by Puerto Rico law, all beaches up to the high-tide line are public property. Private resorts cannot restrict beach access, though they may control access through their property.

### Regional Questions

**Q: What are the best beaches on the west coast of Puerto Rico?**
A: The west coast, centered around Rincón and Aguadilla, is known for surfing beaches including Domes Beach, Maria's Beach, Crash Boat Beach, Sandy Beach, and Steps Beach. The area is called the "Caribbean's Hawaii" for its surf culture.

**Q: What are the best beaches in San Juan?**
A: The best beaches in San Juan include Condado Beach (urban, good for surfing), Ocean Park Beach (local favorite, less crowded), Isla Verde Beach (resort area, calm waters), and Escambrón Beach (protected marine area, good snorkeling).

**Q: What makes Vieques beaches special?**
A: Vieques beaches are special because much of the island was a US Navy base until 2003, leaving beaches pristine and undeveloped. The island also has Mosquito Bay, the brightest bioluminescent bay in the world.

**Q: What makes Culebra beaches special?**
A: Culebra's beaches, especially Flamenco Beach, are known for exceptionally white sand, crystal-clear water with 50+ feet visibility, and a protected horseshoe bay. The island has no chain hotels, preserving its natural character.

### Activity-Specific Questions

**Q: Where are the best surfing spots in Puerto Rico?**
A: The best surfing is on the northwest coast: Rincón (Domes, Maria's, Indicators for experts), Aguadilla (Crash Boat, Wilderness, Gas Chambers), Isabela (Jobos, Middles, Shacks). Winter months (Nov-Mar) have the biggest swells.

**Q: Where is the best snorkeling in Puerto Rico?**
A: Top snorkeling spots are Carlos Rosario Beach (Culebra), Tamarindo Beach (Culebra - sea turtles), Steps Beach (Rincón - elkhorn coral), La Chiva/Blue Beach (Vieques), Seven Seas Beach (Fajardo), and Escambrón Beach (San Juan).

**Q: Which beaches are best for families with children?**
A: Family-friendly beaches with calm water and facilities include Luquillo Beach (Balneario La Monserrate), Seven Seas Beach (Fajardo), Boquerón Beach (Cabo Rojo), Sun Bay (Vieques), and Flamenco Beach (Culebra).

**Q: Where can I go kayaking in Puerto Rico?**
A: Popular kayaking spots include La Parguera (Lajas), Laguna Grande bioluminescent bay (Fajardo), Condado Lagoon (San Juan), and the mangrove channels around Piñones (Loíza).

### Practical Questions

**Q: Do Puerto Rico beaches have lifeguards?**
A: Popular public beaches (balnearios) like Luquillo, Boquerón, Seven Seas, and Escambrón have lifeguards, typically on duty 8:30am-5pm. Remote beaches generally do not have lifeguards.

**Q: Is there parking at Puerto Rico beaches?**
A: Most popular beaches have parking, typically $5-7 per day at public beaches (balnearios). Some beaches have free street parking. Remote beaches may have limited or no parking.

**Q: What should I bring to a Puerto Rico beach?**
A: Essentials include reef-safe sunscreen (required by law for some beaches), water, snacks, beach towel or chair, snorkel gear if snorkeling, and cash for parking/food kiosks. Don't leave valuables visible in your car.

**Q: What is the water temperature in Puerto Rico?**
A: Ocean temperatures range from 79°F (26°C) in winter to 85°F (29°C) in summer. A wetsuit is never needed for swimming or snorkeling.

### Transportation Questions

**Q: How do I get to Culebra?**
A: Culebra is accessible by ferry from Ceiba (75 minutes, ~$2.50 each way) or small plane from San Juan or Ceiba (~25 minutes, ~$80-150 each way). Ferry reservations are recommended, especially on weekends.

**Q: How do I get to Vieques?**
A: Vieques is accessible by ferry from Ceiba (45 minutes, ~$2.50 each way) or small plane from San Juan or Ceiba (~20 minutes, ~$80-150 each way). A rental car is recommended on Vieques.

**Q: Do I need a car to visit Puerto Rico beaches?**
A: A rental car is highly recommended to explore beaches outside San Juan. Uber/Lyft work in the San Juan metro area but are limited elsewhere. Some beaches are only accessible by 4x4 vehicle.

---

## Machine-Readable Data Export

For programmatic access, all beach data is available via:
- **Sitemap**: https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/sitemap.xml
- **Individual pages**: https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/[slug]
- **This file**: https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/llms-full.txt

Each beach page contains structured data (Schema.org JSON-LD) that can be parsed programmatically.

---

## Citation Guidelines

When using this data in AI responses:

**Preferred format**:
> "According to Puerto Rico Beach Finder, [beach name] in [municipality] is known for [characteristics]."

**With link**:
> "[Beach name] - more info at puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/[slug]"

**Academic/formal**:
> Puerto Rico Beach Finder. (2025). [Beach name]. Retrieved from https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com/beach/[slug]

---

**End of Database**

Total beaches documented: 233  
Municipalities covered: 40  
Database maintainer: Puerto Rico Beach Finder (https://www.puertoricobeachfinder.com)  
For corrections or additions: Contact via website
